fields.description:
Category: Cloud
Region: Spain2
Instance Name: arispoitest
Image: Ubuntu 14.04
My Issue: https://jira.fiware.org/browse/WEB-798

Cannot connect to https port 443

Hi,

I am the product owner of FIWARE POI DP GE that I am currently
developing.
I try to test installing https protocol support to my POI DP GE. It
seems that I can successfully install the secure server stuff but
it cannot accessed from the web. Is there some firewall or something
prohibiting port 443 accesses. My FIWARE Lab instance at Spain2 is
arispoitest, internal IP 192.168.224.245, external IP 130.206.118.85.
Or, what to check next?

Best Regards
Ari Okkonen

-- 
Ari Okkonen Adminotech
Since January 1st, old domains won't be supported and messages sent to any domain different to @lists.fiware.org will be lost.
Please, send your messages using the new domain (Fiware-lab-help@lists.fiware.org) instead of the old one.
_______________________________________________
Fiware-lab-help mailing list
Fiware-lab-help@lists.fiware.org
https://lists.fiware.org/listinfo/fiware-lab-help

[Created via e-mail received from: Ari Okkonen ADT <ari.okkonen@adminotech.com>]

fields.description:
Having problems viewing this message, please click here
[http://www.openforumconferences.co.uk/display.php?M=3690995&C=c2a9a91c24a1dc0e81825247115d9351&S=2030&L=498&N=505]
for webversion.


What is the role of charities in the new Sporting Future strategy?

"Sport is a key part of local communities but it looks different in
different places – there is no top down approach that works everywhere."
Sporting Future, 2015

Join us at A New Strategy for Sport: A Change of Approach where we will
discuss the contribution that sport and physical activity has to offer
individuals and communities.

Charities have an important leadership role to play in the new Sporting
Future strategy, however the need for social investment and grants also
plays a vital role in supporting the sustainable development of the sports
sector.


The conference and its networking opportunities will offer the chance to
share best practice, and discuss how grants can be used to set up brilliant
programmes involving sport that can deliver massive benefits to communities
and give people new skills for life and work.


The conference's programme has been designed to give delegates maximum
opportunity to question, express opinions and debate with the plenary
speakers the future for sport.


 Read more >>
[http://www.openforumconferences.co.uk/link.php?M=3690995&N=2030&L=150&F=T]


Book a Place
 [http://www.openforumconferences.co.uk/link.php?M=3690995&N=2030&L=368&F=T]

View Overview
[http://www.openforumconferences.co.uk/link.php?M=3690995&N=2030&L=150&F=T]


View Programme
[http://www.openforumconferences.co.uk/link.php?M=3690995&N=2030&L=151&F=T]

You will hear from:

Andy Reed, Chair and co-founder, Sports Think Tank
- "A New Strategy for Sport - More Engagement with More Sports for More
People"


Jane Ashworth OBE, Chief Executive Officer, StreetGames UK
- " Sport in Disadvantaged Communities "

Professor Kate Ardern, Director of Public Health, Wigan Council
- "Commissioning Physical Activity to Improve Health and Well-being"


Chris Grant, CEO, Sported
- "The Positive Impacts of Community Projects"


Barry Horne, Chief Executive, English Federation of Disability Sport
- "Making Sport and Physical Activity Inclusive for People with
Disabilities"

Speaker TBC, Access Sport


Dean Horridge, Chairman, UKACTIVE KIDS
- "Embedding Sport and Physical Activity in the Younger Generation"


Bryn Price, Director, Safer Kent
- "Using Sport to Assist Young People who are At Risk of Marginalisation
and/or Exclusion"

Panel Debate:
- "Reaching People Outside of Sports Comfort Zone"
Phil Veasey, Public Health and Community Engagement Associate, C3
Collaborating for Health
David Pilkington, Project Manager at ACCENTS - Poplar HARCA
Dr Edwina Brocklesby, Director, Silverfit
Barry Horne, Chief Executive, English Federation of Disability Sport.

View Programme
[http://www.openforumconferences.co.uk/link.php?M=3690995&N=2030&L=151&F=T]


Contact Us

If you would like more information or would like to register for the
conference. Please contact Benjamin Selby on the details below. Invoice
options are available when registering your place.
Benjamin Selby

Marketing Executive
Open Forum Events
ben@openforumconferences.co.uk
0161 376 9007

Unsubscribe
[http://www.openforumconferences.co.uk/link.php?M=3690995&N=2030&L=6&F=T]
